英语C

课程编码：15MGB003H 英文名称：Specialized English 课时：36 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
本课程是为专业学位研究生开设的专业英语课程。专业学位英语研究生在完成基础英语的学习以后，进入专业英语的学习。重点解决学术交流活动中说和写的问题。说的方面，主要培养学生在参加国际学术会议时作口头报告和讨论的口语表达能力，内容涉及语音，口头报告的一般性结构、常用表达方式，口头报告的仪态，就学术问题进行提问和回答的技巧等；写的方面，主要通过系统的训练，使学生能够用英语撰写符合规范的学术论文，特别是英文摘要、引言以及总结的写法。

预修课程

教材
一． Practical Writing 高教出版社
二． 国际学术交流口语 清华大学出版社
三． 自编.

主要内容
1．熟悉和国际交流有关的活动的流程和惯例，并掌握相关的英语表达方式。
2．培养学生参加一般性专业领域的讨论能力。
3．培养学生作口头英语报告的能力。
4. 介绍书面学术文体的一般性特点。
5. 训练书写英文摘要等文体。

参考文献

课程教师信息

日语（二外）（中级）

课程编码：15MGB014H 英文名称：Japanese for Advanced Learners 课时：64 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：马潇漪

教学目的要求
本课程是为我校各学科、各专业硕士、博士研究生中有一定日语基础的学生开设的公共选修课。通过本课程学习，要求学生掌握中级语法和1500个左右单词，并能够用日语进行基本交流，同时能够借助有关工具书阅读专业日文资料。

预修课程

教材
1. 新版标准日本语初级下. 人民教育出版社
2. 北京大学东语系日语教研室《日语》. 商务印书馆
3．网络教材艾琳的挑战（WEB版エリンが挑戦!にほんごできます。）

主要内容
语态：被动，可能，使役
助词：格助词，副助词.接续助词.提示助词.终助词等
助动词：比况,样态,希望,可能助动词等
其它：授受动词,补助动词，形式体言，形式用言，惯用型等

课程教师信息

口译技能训练-01班

课程编码：15MGX001H-01 英文名称：Interpretation Skills 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：彭宇

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共选修课。本课程旨在通过不同专题的口译训练，帮助学生掌握基本的口译技巧，提高学生使用英语的实际能力。

预修课程

教材
一． 实用英语口译教程
二． 现场汉英口译技巧与评析
三． 实用口译手册
四． The Translator’s Guide to Chinglish

主要内容
第一部分为基本技巧部分，着重介绍口译笔记、数字口译和习语口译的方法，配有大量相关练习。
第二部分为专题部分，着重介绍外事接待、观光旅游、教育、文化、体育、科技等专题。每个专题一般由背景知识、表达法、口译练习、实用知识等几个组成部分。背景知识主要介绍中国在有关方面的现状，目的在于帮助学员掌握有关话题的基本情况，增加感性认识，培养学员做译前准备的意识和习惯；表达法部分旨在帮助学员增加词汇量，熟悉有关表达；口译练习是本课程的核心内容，目的是通过较系统的口译训练，逐渐掌握连续翻译的能力，同时熟悉有关话题的热点问题、常用词句等；实用知识部分着重介绍外事工作者经常用到的一些百科知识，拓宽学员的知识面。

参考文献

课程教师信息

课程教师信息

学术交流英语口语-01班

课程编码：15MGX003H-01 英文名称：Spoken English for Academic Activities 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：刘彬

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共选修课。学生应该在硕士学习期间继续提高听、说、读、写、译各个方面的能力，但随着近年来各高校和研究单位的国际合作和交流不断增多，迫切要求学生在此阶段就具备一定的国际性学术交流能力，特别是口语表达能力，如接待外宾，主持国际会议，宣讲论文和参加讨论会等。学生们自己也要走出去，或参加国际会议，或出国深造。因此，他们对这方面的需求也很迫切。通过本门课程的学习，学生应该能够在这类情况下基本应付可能遇到的学术交流任务，掌握这些活动的一般程序和所需的特殊语言技能。

预修课程

教材
一． Presenting in English, by Mark Powell, LTP business, 1996.
二． 《学术交流英语》 王惠莉，高等教育出版社，2006.9

主要内容
1．进一步打好一般性口语基础。
2．熟悉和国际交流有关的活动的流程和惯例，并掌握相关的英语表达方式。
3．培养学生参加一般性专业领域的讨论能力。
4．培养学生作口头英语报告的能力。

基础学术论文写作-01班

课程编码：15MGX004H-01 英文名称：Academic Writing in English 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：Torsten Juelich

教学目的要求
This course will introduce students to the fundamental principles of good academic writing. Our teaching team will use a combination of classic instructive learning and innovative teaching methods, including flipped classroom, in-class group work and peer-reviewing to foster an active approach to learning. The aim of this course is to encourage students to read, write and think in English, with particular focus on problem-solution structures commonly found in the academic literature.
By the end of this course, all students will have a clearidea of the fundamental elements of academic writing, enabling students to continuously improve their analytical thinking skills beyond the timeframe of this course.
Working knowledge of oral and written English is assumed. Active participation throughout the course will be fostered through a participation-based scoring system. The anticipated minimum ratio of in-class hours to homework time will be approx. 1:2.

预修课程

教材
Academic Writing for Graduate Students: Essential Tasks and Skills.John M. Swales and Christine B. Feak (University of Michigan Press ELT; 3rd edition)

主要内容
第一周 Introduction
第二周 Critical Thinking through Writing - Basics
第三周 Writing Exercises
第四周 Academic Writing - Audience and Purpose
第五周 Writing Exercises
第六周 Academic Writing - Style
第七周 Writing Exercises
第八周 Academic Writing - Flow
第九周 Writing Exercises
第十周 Academic Writing -- Organization
第十一周 Writing Exercises
第十二周 Organization of a Scientific Manuscript Part 1
第十三周 Writing Exercises
第十四周 Organization of a Scientific Manuscript Part 2
第十五周 Writing Exercises
第十六周 Research Ethics - Plagiarism and Scientific misconduct

参考文献

课程教师信息
Torsten Juelich, 澳大利亚国立大学（Australian National University）医学科学（分子及细胞生物学）博士，免疫学研究博士后。2009-2012在澳大利亚国立大学生物化学和分子生物学院教授本科生《Gene Expression and Regulation》课程。
2012年来华后，Juelich 博士从事英文学术论文编辑工作至今。他与中国科学院生物物理所等多个实验室建立了稳定的合作关系，并协助京外多所大学、研究机构及医院成功发表学术成果。至今，他已完成共计30余个研究小组的300余篇科研论文的合作撰写与编辑，其中多篇已发表在Science, Nature和Cell等顶级期刊上。
2014年起，Juelich博士受聘于北京大学环境与工程学院，开设《Academic Writing in English》课程；2015年起同时在中科院大学生命科学学院开设英文科技写作硕士课程。2016年春季，他还应邀在中科院计算技术研究所讲授为期6周的英文论文写作培训。

范逸洲，北京大学教育学院博士研究生，主要研究方向为MOOC、教师培训和教学设计。参与设计、开发的《翻转课堂教学法》等MOOC课程，惠及全国近二十万人次的教师学员。近三年，参与教育部科技司、国家自然科学基金课题、IDRC课题等十余项，发表英文论文五篇。

英文名称: English Listening Course for International Communication
详细内容:
国际交流英语听力-01班

课程编码：15MGX005H-01 英文名称：English Listening Course for International Communication 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：彭工

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共选修课。
在语言学习的进程中，听说读写四个技能不可或缺，尤其听的能力尤为重要。学生由于语言环境匮乏，基础不够扎实，在国际合作和交流中听力水平造成的问题比较突出。因此，该课程设置旨在满足学生提高英语听力水平的迫切需求。通过学习，学生应该在听懂国外会议的报告、用英语进行学术交流和日常交流等方面有较大提高。
此外，根据中国目前经济发展状况来看，政府机构和中外企业急需大量具备国际交流能力的人才，该课程也为学生参加符合国际标准的外语资格认定考试（托业考试）提供一些相关练习，提高学生在职场上使用英语交流的能力。

预修课程

教材
国际交流视听说第四册

主要内容
1. 提高日常英语交流能力。
2. 提高工作场景中运用英语的交流能力。
3. 提高在国际学术会议、报告中的使用英语的交流能力等。

高级语音训练-01班

课程编码：15MGX007H-01 英文名称：Advanced Pronunciation Training 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：刘彬

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科，各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设公共选修课。在我们英语A和英语B的教学过程中，我们发现在学生的口头表达中存在着很多的问题，其中基础发音还相当薄弱，以至于一些同学的英语根本无法听懂，更不用说用流畅、优美的英语表达思想了。因此本课程旨在纠正不良的发音习惯，为学生今后能练就标准，流畅的英语口语打下良好的语音基础。通过教授和练习，使学生对基础发音以及和发音相关的语音技巧有一个全面的了解和掌握。

预修课程

教材
1 Well Said. Advanced English Pronunciation by Linda Grant.(with four cassette tapes)
2. Fast Speech English. (Listening Tapes) by Longman Corporation Lt.
3. Listening in the real world.
4. Presenting in English by Mark Powell, LTP Business

主要内容
第一章 建立学生发音错误档案：每个学生从课程的第一单元建立一份档案，记录他们在音素，单词和语句等各层次上的错误和不到位的问题。本档案也作为考核内容的一项依据。
第二章 借助教材，录音材料对英语的辅音，元音音素的准确音质通过单词，短语和句子进行分析，对比，模仿和操练，直到准确为止。
第三章 对连读，同化，除阻，弱读，重音等加以训练。
第四章 语调的训练包括句子重点的突出和节奏的把握，并需结合上述技巧的使用。

参考文献

课程教师信息

德语（二外）

课程编码：15MGX012H 英文名称：German 课时：90 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：沈永前

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院已通过硕士学位英语资格考试的各学科、各专业硕士、博士研究生开设的公共选修课。通过本课程学习，要求学生掌握基本语法和1000个常用单词，并能够借助字典阅读一般德语文章。

预修课程

教材
殷桐生等，《德语300小时》(修订版)，外语教学与研究出版社，2004年3月。

主要内容
1. 德语字母的正确发音及拼读规则；
2. 名词、冠词、代词及形容词的变格及用法、常用介词的基本用法；
3. 德语六种时态的构成、被动态的构成及用法；
4. 基本句型、并列复合句、常用主从复合句；
5. 形容词及副词的比较级和最高级的构成及基本用法；
6. 不定式及分词的基本用法；
7. 虚拟式的构成及基本用法。

参考文献
《德语语法练习》，中国科学院研究生院讲义，2004年9月

课程教师信息

教学目的要求

教材

课程名称: 英语B-301班（怀）-学术论文写作（综合）
详细内容:
英语B-301班（怀）-学术论文写作（综合）

课程编码：15DGB002H-W301 英文名称：PhD English Program 课时：36 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：Raymond Seraphim Porter

教学目的要求
The overall goal of the course is to obtain academic writing skills that scientists and academics need in order to present their research internationally.

The course is designed to help students organize and write the five standard sections of a research article: the Abstract, Introduction, Methods, Results, and Discussion.

There will be four short writing assignments and one in-class writing assignment, each corresponding to the different sections of a research paper.

预修课程

教材
Science Research Writing for Non-Native Speakers of English by Hilary Glasman-Deal

English for Writing Research Papers by Adrian Wallwork

主要内容
This course will focus on writing research articles. We will examine how to organize and write the different sections of a research article. Writing assignments will model these sections, allowing us to develop real world writing skills. Students will have numerous opportunities to draft, revise, and complete writing projects.

参考文献
Scientific Style and Format The CSE Manual for Authors, Editors, and Publishers 8th Edition Council of Science Editors. 2014
A Manual for Writers of Research Papers, Theses, and Dissertations. Chicago Style for Students and Researchers 8th Edition by Kate L. Turabian
English for Research: Usage, Style, and Grammar by Adrian Wallwork

课程教师信息
Raymond Porter studied Evolution and Development at the University of Texas, where he investigated molecular mechanisms of sex-determination in turtles. He is currently English Editor of Kunming Institute of Botany’s Plant Diversity, an international plant science journal.

教学目的要求
This course will provide insight into the American entertainment industry. We will discuss mediums like vaudeville, radio, television, film, Broadway, comedy and music.

预修课程

课程编码：15MGX046H 英文名称：Academic Writing in English-Advanced Course 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：Torsten Juelich

教学目的要求
This course will introduce students to the fundamental principles of good academic writing. Our teaching team will use a combination of classic instructive learning and innovative teaching methods, including flipped classroom, in-class group work and peer-reviewing to foster an active approach to learning. The aim of this course is to encourage students to read, write and think in English, with particular focus on problem-solution structures commonly found in the academic literature.
By the end of this course, all students will have a clearidea of the fundamental elements of academic writing, enabling students to continuously improve their analytical thinking skills beyond the timeframe of this course.
Working knowledge of oral and written English is assumed. Active participation throughout the course will be fostered through a participation-based scoring system. The anticipated minimum ratio of in-class hours to homework time will be approx. 1:2.

预修课程

教材
Academic Writing for Graduate Students: Essential Tasks and Skills.John M. Swales and Christine B. Feak (University of Michigan Press ELT; 3rd edition)

第一周 Introduction
第二周 Critical Thinking through Writing - Basics

Torsten Juelich, 澳大利亚国立大学（Australian National University）医学科学（分子及细胞生物学）博士，免疫学研究博士后。2009-2012在澳大利亚国立大学生物化学和分子生物学院教授本科生《Gene Expression and Regulation》课程。
2012年来华后，Juelich 博士从事英文学术论文编辑工作至今。他与中国科学院生物物理所等多个实验室建立了稳定的合作关系，并协助京外多所大学、研究机构及医院成功发表学术成果。至今，他已完成共计30余个研究小组的300余篇科研论文的合作撰写与编辑，其中多篇已发表在Science, Nature和Cell等顶级期刊上。
2014年起，Juelich博士受聘于北京大学环境与工程学院，开设《Academic Writing in English》课程；2015年起同时在中科院大学生命科学学院开设英文科技写作硕士课程。2016年春季，他还应邀在中科院计算技术研究所讲授为期6周的英文论文写作培训。

课程编码：161MX004H 英文名称：Integrated Water Management and Legislation 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：崔骁勇等

教学目的要求
The objectives of the module are to:
train the students be skilled in how external nutrient reduction affects streams, lakes and reservoirs in different climate zones
provide a basic understanding of physico-chemical and biological restoration methods for streams and lakes/reservoirs
understand basic concepts of crop water relations, water productivity and strategies for efficient water and nutrients (mainly N and P) management in agro-ecosystems
provide an overview and understanding of water legislation, policy and planning in China and the EU
provide a basic understanding of urban water systems, and how nature-based approaches to current freshwater challenges may contribute to climate resilience and sustainable urban development.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
Management
Water dynamics in the soil-plant-atmosphere continuum (SPAC)
Water balance in the field, crop water productivity and irrigation strategies
Plant nutrition functions, plant nutrient deficiency diagnosis
Soil fertility concepts, turnover of N and P in soil and effect on plant nutrient availability
Fertilization strategies and farming systems, methods to improve nutrient use efficiency, reduce N and P losses, improve crop yield and quality
Modelling water, N and P dynamics in the soil-plant systems and losses to the environment
Water Legislation and Policy
 General introduction to water legislation in China and the EU
The challenge of sustainable management – why do we need to regulate the use of resources?
The institutional set-up and main pieces of water legislation in China as part of the evolving national water policy with a particular view to water quality.
SDC MSc in Water and Environment 2015/2016 Fulai Liu
Module 4: Integrated Water Management and Legislation
Page 4
The institutional set-up in the EU and the main elements of EU water policy and legislation with a particular focus on the EU Water Framework Directive and integrated water resource management.
Water policy and implementation
Policy instruments in general: Command-and-control-regulation, economic instruments, information/voluntary instruments. Pros and cons.
Implementation. Potential difficulties in fulfilling policy aims; potential obstacles during the implementation process – for instance at target group level and organizational level?
Water policy instruments– lessons from Europe. Primary focus will be on European experiences with economic policy instruments in water (currently analyzed in a European Union research project called ‘EPI Water’).
Evaluation of environmental policies.
Water planning
Spatial planning principles and water management
Top-down and bottom-up approaches in water management
Management challenges in common-pool resources (such as water)
Comprehensive cross-sectorial planning - policy integration in relation to water management
Urban Water Management
General introduction of urban water systems, challenges and trends in solutions, including water supply and treatment systems, urban drainage and conventional stormwater management
Stormwater quantity conveyance, detention and retention; stormwater quality, control and re-use options
Ecosystem services; non-conventional stormwater management; aquatic ecological restoration in inland urban lakes
General introduction on what a city is, urban development and how to manage transitions towards sustainable development

课程编码：162MX004H 英文名称：Magnetic Resonance Imaging 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：薛蓉等

教学目的要求
Basic MRI covers the basic principles of magnetic resonance (MR) imaging and its use in research. This includes spin dynamics in a magnetic field, interaction of magnetization by radiofrequency pulses, principles of MR imaging using magnetic field gradients, relaxation of magnetization and contrast in images. The most important applications of MR will be introduced. These include angiography and blood flow measurement, perfusion and diffusion assessment and functional MRI. Besides, examples of the clinical use of MR imaging will be given.

- Magnetic dipole moments in a magnetic field

课程编码：162MX005H 英文名称：Pattern Recognition and Predictive Modelling in Neuroscience 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：张三国等

教学目的要求
The aim of this course is to introduce pattern recognition and predictive modelling techniques and enable students to statistically analyze complex data sets as typically encountered in neuroscience. The course introduces topics in unsupervised and supervised learning beginning with presentations of unsupervised learning techniques such as k-means cluster analysis mixture models, as well as dimension reduction techniques. Within supervised learning, In addition, PRPM covers basic and advanced regression models for continuous and binary outcomes including penalized regression and support vector machines. The course emphasizes techniques for model training and assessment as well as variable selection.

预修课程
Knowledge and competence within mathematics equivalent to the Mathematics course in the master’s program. Basic knowledge in biostatistics (ANOVA, regression)

教材
Book: Pattern recognition and machine learning 2nd printing edition by Christopher M. Bishop (2007), Springer
• ISBN 978-0-387-31073-2
• Internet: http://www.amazon.cn/Pattern-Recognition-and-Machine-Learning-Bishop-Christopher-M/dp/0387310738
Book: Introduction to Statistical Learning.
• Internet: Available for free on pdf from this link http://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL

主要内容
Knowledge
At the end of the course the student will be able to:
- Understand mathematical and statistical principles in cluster analysis, Mixture models, Expectation maximization, Latent variable models, Dimension reduction, Regularized regression, Support Vector Machines, Classification, and Model assessment and selection
- Critically reflect on theoretical and practical strengths and shortcomings of the approaches

Skills
At the end of the course the student will be able to
- Apply unsupervised and supervised learning techniques particularly within neuroscience research
- Identify relevant techniques to solve particular problems, and discuss strengths and weaknesses of different approaches
- Concisely account for solution strategy and analysis results, as necessary for publication in scientific journals or prototyping machine learning algorithms

Competencies
At the end of the course the student will be able to
- Independently develop analysis strategies and apply combinations of statistical methodologies to solve research-based problems within neuroscience
- Become proficient in novel techniques (not covered in lectures) by studying and critically reviewing research articles

课程编码：162MX006H 英文名称：Magnetoencephalography (MEG) and Electroenephalography (EEG) 课时：53 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘祖祥

教学目的要求
The synaptic signalling of the brain generates currents that in turn are associated with electric and magnetic fields strong enough to be recorded non-invasively on the surface of the human head. We begin the course with a close look at the fundamental biophysical properties of brain electrophysiological signals recorded by electro- (EEG) and/or magnetoencephalography (MEG), and draw attention to their complementarity with tomographic neuroimaging techniques. Considerable effort is made to understand the complex relationship between measured M/EEG signals and the spatial configuration of their generators in the brain. Such insight is not only key to correct interpretation of measurements, but also required for building a physiologically meaningful model that may be used to obtain estimates of cortical source locations. Signal detection itself, especially the multitude of possible sensor configurations, plays a critical role in determining how neuronal activity is reflected in the recordings. Hands-on laboratory exercises introduce students to the practical aspects of data collection, from preparation to acquisition and quality assurance. The event-related paradigm is the workhorse of M/EEG-based scientific inquiry, and is therefore used as an example of how brain function may be quantified using data analysis concepts and methods introduced during lectures and computer exercises. The aim of the course is to provide students with a solid foundation from which to develop a deeper understanding of the study of human brain electrophysiology using state-of-the-art techniques and experimental paradigms.

预修课程

教材
1. S. Luck, “An Introduction to the Event-Related Potential Technique”, 2nd Edition, The MIT Press, 2014.
• ISBN-13: 978-0262525855
• Detailed reading list will be provided during the course
2. Handouts (provided by the lecturers), containing published and original materials

主要内容
Knowledge
Successful completion of the course will enable the student to:
• Describe the biophysical model of the generators of the electric and magnetic fields that are measurable from outside the human head, and
• Characterize the coupling of EEG and MEG measurements to these fields, and the fundamental limitations on the signal information content imposed by physics
• Discuss method and parameter choices for obtaining spatially resolved estimates of current sources in the brain

参考文献
Skills
During the course the student will learn to:
• Identify artifactual M/EEG signal components and apply relevant signal processing tools for the mitigation of their effects on measures-of-interest
• Process M/EEG recordings and extract data features that address a physiologically or cognitively motivated question

Competencies
After the course the students can:
• Outline strategies for design, implementation, interpretation and adequate reporting of an event-related M/EEG experiment
• Reflect on ways to quantify experimental M/EEG data in order to reveal aspects of the underlying brain function
• Disseminate published literature and offer principled interpretation of results

课程编码：162MX007H 英文名称：Neurotransmission, Neuropsychology, Psychiatry, and Neuropharmacology 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：赫荣乔等

教学目的要求
This course builds upon the knowledge obtained in IN, MNN, and FCN with a focus on the communication between the cells of the brain and how this is studied using EEG & other neurophysiologic methods as well as PET, autoradiography and radiochemistry. Thus, several signaling systems of the brain will be introduced together with an account of the diseases of the brain caused by changes in these systems. Furthermore, the students will be given an introduction to common psychiatric disorders and the neuropharmacological treatment of these disorders such as affective disorders - unipolar (depression) and bipolar (manic-depressive); schizophrenia; anxiety disorders; OCD; eating- and personality disorders; psychiatric disorders in children; abuse and dependence disorders and pathological gambling.

预修课程
Knowledge equivalent to Basic Neuroscience, Fundamental Biomedical Signal Processing and Medical Imaging Techniques.

教材
Book: Neuroscience, Fifth Edition edited by Dale Purves et al.
 ISBN-10: 0878936467
 http://www.amazon.com/Neuroscience-Looseleaf-Fifth-Dale-Purves/dp/0878936467
Book: Shorter Oxford Textbook of Psychiatry 6th edition by Philip Cowen, Paul Harrison, and Tom Burns (2012), Oxford University Press
 ISBN 978-0-199-60561-3
 Internet: http://www.amazon.cn/Shorter-Oxford-Textbook-of-Psychiatry-Cowen-Philip/dp/0199605610/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1360236089&sr=8-1
 e-book:
o http://www.amazon.com/Shorter-Oxford-Textbook-Psychiatry-ebook/dp/B009GHORXY/ref=tmm_kin_title_0
Book: Gurd, Kischka, & Marshall (2010). Handbook of Clinical Neuropsychology, Oxford University Press
 ISBN-13: 978-0199645817

主要内容
Knowledge
The course will enable the student to understand and reflect on:
- Nerve cells communication through different signaling systems of the brain
- Central neuroscience topics related to both normal brain function and neuropsychiatric disorders.
- How neuroanatomy affects mental functions
- How drug design builds on molecular engineering
Skills
During the course the student will acquire skills in:
- Basic features and applications of several important methodologies in neuroscience such as stereology, brain wave recording, transcranial magnetic stimulation, and advanced neuroimaging
- Technical advances and computer software for image analysis
- The molecular basis of mental function in health and disease with particular focus on serotonergic, noradrenergic, and dopaminergic mechanisms
- The behavioral disturbances affected by these neurotransmitters with focus on dementia, depression, psychosis, and impulse disorders from a biopsychosocial perspective
- The treatment of the described disorders
Competencies
At the end of the course the student will be able to:
- Select and certify the most suitable methodologies for studying neurological disorders
- Reflect on the cause of behavioral disturbances and propose research solutions
- Critically review scientific publications dealing with neurological diseases
- Combine molecular, anatomical and signaling knowledge to gain insight and suggest research approaches in the study of diseases of the brain

课程编码：162MX008H 英文名称：Integrative Neuroimaging 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：王帆

教学目的要求
Neuroimaging techniques are capable of probing physiology and function at molecular, cellular and system levels, in animal models and humans. However, each imaging modality has
its unique strength and inherent limitations. Moreover, most imaging modalities are correlative in nature, precluding causal inferences. The aim of the Integrative Neuroimaging
Course is to give the students the possibility to gain experience in the rapidly advancing field of multimodal imaging. The students will learn about when, why, and how to combine different imaging modalities. The course will provide the students with a “multimodal imaging framework” which will help to critically interpret literature within the
field and to optimally plan scientific projects in the field of brain imaging. During the course the following topics will be covered in overview lectures or exercises:

• Introduction into the concepts behind integrative multimodal imaging.
• General analysis techniques useful for integration of modalities
• Integration of electrophysiology (EEG/ERP/MEG) and functional MRI
• Introdution to transcranial brain stimulation (TMS, TDCS) and deep brain stimulation
• Combining EEG and TMS/TDCS
• Neurostimulation and neuroimaging: TMS & fMRI, offline and online
• Integration of MR--‐related techniques: structural MRI (sMRI) and diffusion weighted MRI (DWI)
• Combining sMRI and functional MRI (fMRI)
• Combining DWI & fMRI
• Integrating DWI and TMS
• Integration of MR--‐based techniques with positron emission tomography

预修课程
Basic knowledge of the major brain mapping techniques (structural and functional MRI, diffusion sensitive MRI, PET, EEG, MEG) Basic experience with Matlab and MRI data analysis software

教材
Book: Oxford Handbook of Transcranial Stimulation 1st edition by Eric Wassermann, Charles Epstein, Ulf Ziemann (2008), Oxford University Press

主要内容
Knowledge
By the end of the course, the student will have
- Acquired indepth knowledge about how the combined use of brain mapping modalities can help overcome modality inherent weaknesses and to maximize the modality specific scientific potential
- Basic knowledge about how to model multimodal imaging data
- Knowledge on how to critically review own and published multimodal results
- The ability to understand, reflect over and explain how to best integrate two imaging modalities
- Acquired knowledge to be able to identify neuroscientific questions that can best be studied with an integrative neuroimaging approach

Skills The student will be able to:
- Design a multimodal neuroimaging study: Identify the most relevant neuroimaging techniques, choose the most appropriate analysis tools and discuss strengths and weaknesses of different approaches
- Explain how to incorporate interventional approaches (TMS, TDCS) in brain mapping studies
- Explain the technical and computational challenges of multimodal integration
- Co-register multimodal imaging data and integrate data sets acquired in different imaging modalities for subsequent analysis
- Evaluate the choice of method for multimodal integration
- Evaluate and choose the most appropriate neurostimulation techniques and protocols
- Account for solution strategy and analysis of results, as necessary for publication in scientific journals
- Disseminate knowledge about integrative neuroimaging and discuss related professional and scientific topics with both peers and non-specialists

Competencies
This course provides the students with the capacity to:
- Overview complex experimental situations that require the integration of two imaging modalities
- Plan and pursue interdisciplinary cooperation with researchers using complementary imaging modalities
- Develop new ideas on how to improve multimodal integration and implement novel applications for integrative neuroimaging
- Acquired knowledge to be able to identify neuroscientific questions that can best be studied with an integrative neuroimaging approach

课程编码：165MX005H 英文名称：Process Design - Principles and Methods 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
Process design involves the solution of open-ended problems. The design problem is first defined and then broken
down into a set of sub-problems (tasks) that are solved in a specified sequence. In each task, a set of design decisions
are made, analyzed and verified. Therefore, the final process design and the path to achieve it depend on the design
decisions taken in each of the design tasks. This means that there could be many process designs for the defined design
problem. In this course, the process design problem solution is broken down into 12 design tasks, to be performed in a
specific sequence.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
• Make design related decisions
• Use knowledge to solve practical engineering problems
• Analyse data
• Work in groups
• Use computer aided tools
• Generate and screen alternatives
• Verify and analyse simulation results
• Formulate process design problems and to develop systematic solution strategies
• Apply chemical engineering principles learned from other courses
• Apply “green” or environmental issues in process design

预修课程

教材
Lorenze T. Biegler, Ignacio E. Grossmann and Arthur W. Westerberg: Systematic Methods of Chemical Process Design, Prentice Hall, 1997.

主要内容
The course will be divided into two parts. The first part will deal with introduction to process design principles, the
stages of the process design life cycle and the preliminary design steps (flow sheet synthesis, equipment sizing/costing,
economic evaluation, scheduling of batch operations, distillation sequences, pinch analysis). The second part will
deal with conceptual design (advanced process synthesis (such as heat integration, heat exchanger networks, reactor
networks, reaction-separation sequences, solvent selection), equipment selection, flow sheet optimization).

课程编码：165MX006H 英文名称：Coating Science and Technology 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The course aims at qualifying the students to combine previously acquired knowledge on chemical engineering with
sustainability assessment methods. Environmental impacts and effects of resource constraints on energy supply and
consumption will be analyzed at local and global scales.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
• Characterize and apply different principles of sustainability and sustainable development with focus on resource use
and environmental impacts
• Describe and discuss the sensitivity of the climate system as well as of our society to GHG emissions from energy
conversion and use
• Plan strategic sustainable development of a region with special focus on energy supply and consumption using back
casting from sustainability principles
• Identify and discuss consequences of resource limitations for future energy technologies
• Discuss different criteria for sustainability of biofuels with focus on GHG emissions and energy consumption
• Explain the principles of life cycle assessments. Identify and discuss challenges in their application
• Perform and evaluate simple EROI calculations (energy return on energy investment) for different energy technologies
• Critically examine results from life cycle inventories to evaluate a number of different energy technologies including
those based on biomass

预修课程

教材
Compendium consisting mainly of published papers and book chapters

主要内容
The course aims at providing an understanding of general principles of sustainability and sustainable development in a
system perspective. Briefly we will introduce how the climate system works and how it responds to greenhouse gas (GHG)
emissions from fossil fuel emissions and land use change. We will discuss the implications of the interactions between
population, energy consumption, affluence and climate change for sustainable development. We deal specifically with
a number of renewable energy technologies with focus on bioenergy and evaluate them from a life cycle perspective
based on energy and material flows in specific socio-ecological contexts. We deal with the basic concepts of life cycle
assessments, e.g. system boundary, functional unit, co-products/by-products and normalization. Data sources and the
implications of uncertainty of the calculated indicators for the quality of the assessment will be discussed.

课程编码：166MX005H 英文名称：Nanoelectronics 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：裘晓辉等

教学目的要求
We aim at giving a phenomenological introduction to selected topics in the physics of nanostructures. The general theme is current flow (electron transport) in (low-dimensional) nanoscale structures, where quantum effects are expressed clearly. The basic formalism, key concepts and real experiments will be discussed, rather than complete theoretical treatments, which are covered in other courses. The students will be provided with the background for understanding a wealth of recent experiments in the field which ranges from quantum Hall physics, single-electron transport through “artificial atoms” in semiconductor structures to real “molecular transistors” based on single molecules. In addition to the purely scientific interest, these phenomena are also of technological importance in nanoelectronics and potential future applications in quantum information processing.

Electronic transport in nanostructures. The course will cover the following areas: concepts in electron transport, current flow in nanostructures, mesoscopic electron transport, the quantization of charge, and conductance and their consequences for transport, Landauer (transmission) formalism. The chosen examples will include quantum wires, low dimensional semiconductor structures, quantum dots, graphene, carbon nanotubes, molecular transistors, and other timely subjects in nanoelectronics. One session will be devoted to nano fabrication.
The course also includes two laboratory experiments:
A) Measurement of the Quantum Hall effect and Shubnikov de Haas oscillations in a two-dimensional electron gas at low temperatures (4 Kelvin).
B) Fabrication (or measurements) of graphene quantum dots.
The experimental results are to be analyzed in context of the theory presented in the course and summarized in reports written in groups of 3-4 students.

预修课程

教材
The course will combine textbook material with recent research reports and reviews. Students are expected to participate actively in this approach, e.g. by engaging in informal classroom discussion.

主要内容
After completing the course the student should to receive the top grade be able to:
• demonstrate understanding of the basic formalism and the key concepts within electron transport
• describe the differences between transport in bulk materials (metals, semiconductors) and nanostructures
• explain the most prominent consequences of quantum effects in electron transport through nanostructures (limited to the contents of the course)
• describe the functionality of selected nanoelectronic devices based on these principles
• differentiate between various regimes of mesoscopic electron transport
• sketch the key elements in realizing an electron transport experiment on a nanostructure
• identify the relevant physical parameters in such an experiment, e.g. the essential length scales, energy scales, characteristic temperatures, quantized units etc
• carry out experiments on simple experimental setups for measurements of nanodevices
• know basic low-temperature techniques for measuring of nanodevices
• apply theory from the course on experimental data to extract relevant parameters
• write a report presenting relevant theory, experimental results and analysis
• differentiate between ideal theoretical quantum phenomena and measurements under less ideal conditions
• present clearly the phenomena reported in a research article within the field of experimental electron transport in nanostructures (in the following referred to as “the article”)
• differentiate between the essential information and technical details in the article
• reproduce and discuss the main features and trends in graphical representations of transport data
• relate the findings to the theory treated in the course
• relate or contrast to relevant examples (e.g. other articles) known from the course in order to demonstrate a broader understanding of the field
• evaluate critically the article’s conclusions to the extent that the background for this discussion has been treated in the course

课程编码：166MX006H 英文名称：Bionanomaterials 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：杨延莲等

教学目的要求
To provide background knowledge about bionanomaterials based on the assembly of nucleic acid, peptide and protein. To introduce latest achievements in basic research and potential applications.

Self-assembly of biological molecules. Design and assembly principle of DNA and RNA nanostructures: build 3D nanostructures with controlled size and geometry. DNA based organic synthesis. Modification of nucleic acids nanostructures with various functional elements. Nucleic acids based imaging probes and drug delivery system. Artificial molecular devices. Construction of peptide assembly nanosctructures. Protein assembly nanostructures. Peptide assembly based nanomaterials. Biomedical application of peptide based nanomaterials. Disease associated peptide and protein assembly

预修课程

教材
Nucleic Acid Nanotechnology, Springer 2014, Editor: Jorgen Kjems, Elena Ferapontova, Kurt, V. Gothelf

主要内容
At the end of the course, the student is expected to be able to:
•describe the basic concept of DNA and RNA nanotechnology; explain and compare different strategies to assemble DNA nanostructure;design DNA nanostructures with provided software relate models of designed nanostructures to fabrication of nucleic acids nanomaterials; explain the strategies to assemble metal nanoparticle for plasmonic study and encapsulate drug molecules for therapeutic purpose.
•read and give a short presentation of a scientific paper within the subject area understand the basic concept of peptide and protein assembly; understand the interaction mechanism between peptides in peptide and protein assembly; describe the possible aggregation pathways in peptide assembly; explain the strategies to design peptide assembly nanostructures for biomedical applications;
• expose the above goals in a scientifically correct language.

课程编码：166MX007H 英文名称：Business Innovation and Entrepreneurship 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：胡志远

教学目的要求
Taking consideration that more natural sciences graduates will working in companies under real business contexts, or start building new businesses as their career choices, this course will provide an introduction to main concepts and theories related to innovation, organization, and entrepreneurship.
How to organize and manage technological activities is an important part of a high-velocity global market. To keep competitive advantage in such a dynamic global market, companies and organizations are required to change and develop continuously, i.e. innovation. On the other hand, to take advantage of the new global and technological opportunities, the existing firms reorganise to become more intrapreneurial which involves the spotting, developing, and pursuing of business opportunities, by creating innovative projects inside the company.
The main subjects covered are:
•The concepts of innovation, entrepreneurship, and organization
•Organization structure and design
•Leadership and Intrapreneurship
•Innovation project and management

The course primarily uses lectures, cases, discussions and students’ active involvement. By the end of the course, the students are expected to relate nanotechnology knowledge and knowledge learnt from this course to:
• Understand and explain the concepts and principles of innovation, and identify different types of innovations.
• Understand the concept of entrepreneurship, and be able to identify nanotechnology related business opportunities.
• Design their own business models and organizations for new businesses.
• Understand basic tools of project management, and apply to own nanotechnology related innovation projects.

预修课程

教材
Mowery, D.C., and Nelson, R.R., The Oxford Handbook of Innovation, pp: 1-27.
• Gartner, W.B. (1990), What are we talking about when we talk about entrepreneurship, Journal of Business Venturing, 5, pp: 15-28.
• McKelvey and Lassen (2013) Managing Knowledge Intensive Entrepreneurship, Elgar. Available as e-book on e.g. e-books.com

主要内容
This Module contains three parts:
• The basics of innovation, entrepreneurship and organization
• Leadership, intrapreneuership and business model
• Innovation project management
For each part, there will be 3-4 sessions of teaching, for each session, it will be 3 teaching hours. The students are required to read and reflect on the literature, proactively engage in class discussions, and then

课程编码：166MX008H 英文名称：Nano Energy Materials 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：魏志祥等

教学目的要求
Description of fundamental concepts in the synthesis, physical properties, and applications of nano energy materials.

Crystal structures and bonding in solids. Short introduction to X-ray diffraction and its use for analysis of crystalline materials. Interpretation and use of phase diagrams. Defects. The electrical and magnetic properties of solids and nanoparticles. Emphasis will be placed on relations between structure and properties. Surface energy of nanoparticles. Nucleation and growth theory. Nanoparticle interaction and synthesis methods. Applications of nanomaterials for energy applications.

预修课程

教材
A.R. West: ”Basic Solid State Chemistry” 2nd ed., Wiley 1999
Guozhong Cao: ”Nanostructures & Nanomaterials: Synthesis, Properties & Applications”, Imperial College Press, London 2004. Chapter 1-3, (available as e-book from the Danish libraries)
R. Hoffmann, “How chemistry and physics meet in the solid state.” Angewandte Chemie-International Edition in English 26, 846 (1987).

主要内容
At the end of the course, the student should be able to:
Explain the interrelationship between band structure and properties
Explain basic phase diagrams and relate it to phase transformations in materials
Explain basic nucleation theory.
Explain nanoparticle interaction.
Relate surface physics and chemistry to nanoparticle morphology.
Relate nanoparticle morphology and size to its properties.
Explain the fundamental concepts of the following technologies, and the role and benefits of nanomaterials: Thermoelectrics, Photovoltaics, Magnetic materials, Batteries, Hydrogen storage.
Express the above goals verbally in a scientifically clear, correct and engaging language.

课程编码：167MX005H 英文名称：Personalized Track 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The main objective of this part of the Omics education is to provide the individual student with needed basic knowledge required to select a theme for the master thesis, and moreover provide a contact that can serve as a ”help-desk” throughout the whole study, although with main emphasis on the final Master’s thesis. Thus, this course will be the glue of the entire study programme. The objective is to introduce a range of applications of Omics and presentation of various relevant areas of research, which will help the student in selecting his/her personal “biological” question that will follow the student through the study programme and form the basis for the Master thesis. Skills acquired in the technical, analytical, biological and bioinformatics focussed courses, as well as “Entrepeneurship” will be applied to the personal “biological” question selected.
Moreover, the student will learn about project management , scientific writing and oral presentation of a scientific topic to peers and to non-experts. Standards in publication ethics and scientific conduct will be discussed. Scientific standards that are expected by peer-reviewed journals will be presented.

Suggested topics for biological areas:
1. Omics in medical applications (e.g. metabolic-, degenerative-, and cancer diseases)
2. Omics and microbiology
3. Omics and plant biology
4. Omics and agriculture (e.g. animal breeding, food and soil).

课程编码：167MX006H 英文名称：Core Technology in Genomics 课时：100 学分：5.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：方向东等

教学目的要求
Biosciences in the post genome era are a technology driven field. Progress depends on investigating molecular changes with large scale technologies. This course aims to build basic understanding of the technologies and methods used to characterize and detect variations in genome, transcriptome, proteome, and metabolites of, humans, animals, plants and microorganisms, and to provide students with knowledge sufficient for evaluating the specific strength, weakness and possibility of individual basic methods for characterizing biological systems at molecular levels. The course will provide the students with the skills to understand explain and select the relevant basic methods for characterizing biological systems by large scale molecular mapping methods. The students will develop the skills to evaluate the strengths and shortcomings of specific technological approaches currently available for describing genome, proteome, transcriptome and metabolome changes in biological systems. The competences achieved are appropriate for preparing the students to design their own experimental approaches for final master projects.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
• Mass spectrometry technology (Instrumentation, Electrospray ionization, Maldi-TOF, ion optics, mass analyzers and operation)
• Practical introduction to Protein id and characterization in Proteomics and Metabolomics. Interpretation of data including post-translational modifications.
• Protein and metabolite quantification (LC-MS/MS, SRM and MRM methods)
• Array technology applied in omics
• Advanced Imaging in omics (EM, MALDI Imaging)
• NMR based metabolomics
• Next generation DNA sequencing
• RNAseq based transcriptomics
• microRNA technology

课程编码：167MX008H 英文名称：Bioinformatics and Systems Biology 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
Enabling students with a basic background in various aspects of Bioinformatics, as well as an introduction to Systems biology. Through case stories utilising a broad range of integrative bioinformatics as well as exposure to analysing data types that are currently topical in life sciences research. The course aim is also to provide the student with a good introduction to the Unix command line and programming techniques that will form the basis for exercises during the coursework.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
The advent of Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) technologies have transformed how biological research is being performed and today almost all biological fields use the technology for cutting edge discoveries. Today, a human genome can today be sequenced in very short time for approximately $1000 giving unprecedented possibilities for investigating human traits, evolution and diseases. Similarly whole bacterial communities and their interplay with the environment can be studied, unravelling novel enzymes and organisms. As these experiments produce massive amounts of data bioinformatics skills and supercomputing is crucial for the analysis. The aim of the course is to give the students a good basic handling of the Unix command line for handling large data sets, knowledge of the NGS technology and steps for sequence data analysis as well as a background to Bioinformatics
in general and an introduction to systems biology.

This course provides an introduction to elementary Unix, basic programming principles and good programming practices. The Unix introduction covers basic commands, file manipulation and input/output redirection. The idea is to equip the student for handling common bioinformatic file formats and forming a good basis for the computer exercises which are integrated with the lectures.

The student will get an introduction to the most commonly used bioinformatics databases, such as Genbank, PDB, UniProt and SwissProt and work with bioinformatic algorithms such as BLAST, PSI-BLAST and pairwise- and multiple alignment. Weight-matrix based methods will be introduced and how to search using weight-matrices. An introduction to broader topics such as network biology, metagenomics and cancer informatics will also feature on the course to provide a vision for the breadth of Omics data and how their utilisation leads to translational impact.

课程编码：167MX009H 英文名称：Biostatistics 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：张世华

教学目的要求
Sophisticated statistical methods for analyzing omics data are increasingly employed to deal with the complex data sets from the high-thoughput experiments. With statistical tools, scientists generate testable hypotheses and draw the scientific conclusions supported by data. This course aims to build basic understanding of the theoretical and practical aspects of various biostatistical concepts and analytical methods commonly used in the omics filed. It focuses on the concepts of experimental design, qualitative and quantitative analysis of data, and statistical inferences. The course also aims to provide the students with knowledge sufficient for evaluating the specific strength, weakness and possibility of individual statistical methods as well as the capability to critically read articles on the subject. In addition, this course will provide a hands-on tutorial on anlyzing data with R, the most important statistical tool in academy.

预修课程

教材
Robert R. Sokal and F. James Rohlf.(2011) Biometry (ISBN: 9780716786047)

主要内容
1. Descriptive statistics
2. Introduction to probability
3. Introduction to hypothesis testing (for two groups of numbers)
4. Introduction to multiple hypothesis testing
5. Introduction to analysis of variance (ANOVA)
6. 2 by 2 contingency table
7. Linear regression
8. Correlation
9. Principal component analysis (PCA) and cluster analysis
10. Statistical power
11. Data transformation
12. Data visualization

课程编码：167MX010H 英文名称：Food Omics 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The “omics” disciplines are strongly in demand in the sectors of food, agriculture, biotechnology and applied microbiology. In these areas “omics” represent a largely underexploited potential of technologies with great promise to advance developments to gain insights at the molecular level into e.g. quality of foods, feed and raw materials, nutritional values, probiotics, crop plant breeding, processes in food production, biotechnology and fermentation and food ingredients. The use of “omics” techniques is rapidly implemented in these fields of fundamental and applied research with anticipated huge benefits involving also development of dedicated emerging “omics” tools.
The course aims to provide a broad knowledge of the use of “omics” in food science concerned with cereals, vegetables, probiotic bacteria, livestock, meat and dairy products. It will provide background into the technical sub-disciplines of proteomics with reported application in the various areas of food and agricultural sciences. It focuses on the experimental design from sample preparation to qualitative and quantitative analysis of data. Case stories will be selected to cover various thematics including also functional properties of key proteins involved e.g. i) uptake and metabolism of prebiotic oligosaccharides by probiotic bacteria from the human gut, ii) redox control systems in cereals and microbes in relation to food biotechnology, iii) quality of selected foods. The course also aims to provide the students with knowledge sufficient for proposing research strategies to address objectives to be pursued in the areas of food and agricultural sciences and to evaluate the specific strength, weakness and possibility of individual experimental plans and projects as well as the competence to critically read articles on the subject.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
1. Lectures on relevant techniques in proteomics
2. Introduction to the area of food and agricultural sciences
3. Description of case stories on “omics” in probiotics bacteria
4. Description of case stories “omics” in crop cereals for functional properties and quality
5. Description of case stories “omics” in livestock, vegetables, other raw materials
6. Description of case stories “omics” redox-active processes in lactic acid bacteria and cereal crops
7. The discovery chain from “2D spots to 3D structures” and ”omics”-based identification of key proteins
8. Production using recombinant techniques and characterization of key proteins in cereals and probiotics
9. PULs gene clusters (PULs = polysaccharide utilization loci) in probiotic bacteria, “omics” and phylogenetic analysis
10. Future perspectives

Nanobiology is to understand the Biological Science in the nanometer scale. 课程编码：1701M1022H 英文名称：Molecular Entomology and Plant Pathology 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘俊等

教学目的要求
This course will cover the basis of modern agriculture biotechnology, molecular entomology and plant pathology. In the first part, we will explain the importance of insect science and its impact on agriculture, forest, and human health. We will also discuss several important aspects of molecular insect such as metabolism, endocrinology, immunity, locomotors system etc. The basic knowledge of insect physiology, molecular biology, and biochemistry, which were used to study entomology, will be provided during the class. The second part of the course will give students the general view of the history and development of plant pathology. Particularly, the concepts of plant innate immunity and plant epidemiology will be introduced and emphasized, including PAMPs triggered immunity, effector triggered immunity and basal defense of plants. In addition, plant pathogen isolation and identification and plant protection will be discussed in the course.

教学目的要求
Conservation Biology is a science of protecting biodiversity, preventing human introduced species extinctions and maintaining sustainable development of human society. As a new branch of science, Conservation Biology was established in mid-1990s in the United States of America, and have fully grown into a main stream science since its’ born. In this course, I will give an introduction about the history, scope and missions as well as theoretic frames and practice means of Conservation Biology.

Lecture 3: Biodiversity in China
Lecture 4: Extinction and IUCN Red lists
Lecture 5: Protected areas

课程编码：1701M1021H 英文名称：Vector and Human Pathogen 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：郑爱华等

教学目的要求
This course will introduce the principle of molecular entomology and microbiology. In the first part, we will introduce the importance of insect transmitted diseases and their impact on human health, economy and safety. In the second part, we will discuss several kinds of important human pathogens including the bacteria, plasmodium, and particularly virus. The basic knowledges of virus isolation, virus structure, virus life cycle will be provided in this course. In the third part, we will discuss several important aspects of molecular entomology such as metabolism, endocrinology, immunity, and their relations to the transmission of pathogens. During this course, the progress and application of some of the hottest technologies including CRISPR-Cas9 and deep sequencing will also be discussed.

课程编码：1701M1025H 英文名称：Epigenetics 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：张晓明等

教学目的要求
RNA silencing and Epigenetics are two of the most hot topics in the past two decades. RNA silencing is a general regulation mechanism in eukaryotes that regulates gene expression by 20-30 nt sRNAs in transcription or post-transcription levels. In the first part, we will study RNA silencing on sRNA generation, amplification, loading, action, turnover, and function. Epigenetics is the study of heritable changes in gene expression that do not change DNA sequence. In the second part, we will introduce how DNA methylation, histone modification, chromatin remodeling, long non-coding RNAs and RNA modification regulate gene expression in eukaryotes. We will also talk about the most popular technologies used in Epigenetic studies.

预修课程
Without

教材

主要内容
This course not only will provide students the basic concepts of RNA silencing and Epigenetics, but also will provide student the requisite methods in these two fields. At the same time, we will share the students a story in RNA silencing or Epigenetic fields in each class. These stories include but not limit to: Transgenic technology, Cross-kingdom RNA silencing, anti-viral function of RNA silencing, X-inactivation, Transgenerational epigenetic inheritance, Imprinting, disease, Honey bee epigenome, and flowing. After the course, the students should understand the biogenesis and function of sRNA, the difference between genetic and epigenetic regulation, and how to study projects relate to RNA silencing and Epigenetics.

Kenneth Alan Howard (2013) RNA Interference from Biology to Therapeutics (Advances in Delivery Science and Technology), Springer.
Tamas Dalmay (2017), Plant Gene Silencing: Mechanisms and Applications, CABI press.

课程编码：1707M1026H 英文名称：Nanotechnology for Solar Energy Utilization 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：贺涛

教学目的要求
Because of concerns regarding energy security, environmental crisis, and the rising costs of fossil-fuel-based energy, there has been significant, resurgent interest in utilization of solar energy recently due to its clean nature and abundance of the source. Unfortunately, the utilization efficiency is still pretty low, which dramatically limits the wide use of solar energy. Nanotechnology may afford a solution to this. Thus, the major goal of this course is to provide the students general concepts and state-of-the-art developments in the field of nanotechnology for solar energy utilization. The course begins with a brief introduction of fundamentals of nanotechnology and solar energy. Then photon (light) management is discussed in detail, followed by a thorough description of conversion of light into electric energy (photovoltaics) and chemical energy (artificial photosynthesis). Detailed discussion of environmental remedy is covered too. Other applications such as thermoelectricity and thermochemistry are presented in the final session.

预修课程
Materials physics, materials chemistry, solid state physics, semiconductor physics, physical chemistry, general chemistry

教学目的要求
Biosensing and imaging using nanomaterials and nanotechnology has the potential to revolutionize scientific research and medical diagnostics. This course will focus on the principles, construction, and application of Nano-biosensing and imaging systems, and particularly the impact of nanotechnology on the development of biosensors. The course will be started with an introduction of the solid background on the nano-biological sensors, bioimaging, nanomaterials and nanotechnology, biorecognition units, biomarkers, and disease diagnostics. Then, examples of biosensing and imaging systems created from various nanomaterials are introduced, including fluorescent/luminescent nanoparticles, magnetic nanoparticles, carbon nanomaterials, gold nanoparticles, porous materials, and DNA nanostructures, with a distinct emphasis on the need to tailor nanosensor designs to specific biotargets. The topic of cancer-specific nano-biosensors will also be addressed and discussed to provide deep insight into the recent advances of using nano-biosensors for disease diagnostics and therapy.

课程编码：1702M1030H 英文名称：Plate Tectonics and Evolution of Tibetan Plateau 课时：60 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：丁林等

教学目的要求
Plate tectonics is the integrated theory of how the large-scale geologic structures on Earth are created. Plates are created where they separate and recycled where they converge, in a continuous process of creation and destruction. The lithosphere—Earth’s strong, rigid outer shell of rock—is broken into about a dozen plates, which slide by, converge with, or separate from each other as they move over the weaker, ductile asthenosphere. Continents, embedded in the lithosphere, drift along with the moving plates. The theory of plate tectonics describes the movement of plates and the forces acting between them. This moving and other related concepts cause all the physical features that we see on the planet: mountain ranges, deep canyons, large continents separated by wide and deep oceans. To begin our explanation of the key elements of plate tectonics theory, we will learn about the physical and chemical structures of the earth, three types of plate boundaries, subduction zones and other special locations on plates. We will see how continents break apart, how they collide, and what makes plates move. Because plate tectonics theory is geology’s grand unifying theory, it is now an essential foundation for the discussion of all geology.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
Collision between India and Asia was perhaps the most spectacular geological event to occur over the last 500 million years ago (Ma). However, although there are numerous records of ocean closures and continental collisions in geological history, the connection between India and Asia has attracted a great deal of attention because of the resultant formation of the vast and high-altitude Tibetan Plateau. The ongoing process of collision also affected Tibet as well as central and southeast Asia. As a result, collision between India and Asia as the resultant formation of the Tibetan Plateau likely includes a number of unique processes of both continental collision and mechanisms of intracontinental deformation. The initial collision between India and Asia also provides important data to studies of continental lithospheric deformation, environmental change, and paleoaltitude reconstruction. Thus, this collision has significance to our understanding of plate tectonics, continental dynamics, and multilayer interactions. It will cover the following topics:

教学目的要求
Climate Change 2019 spring semester is designed as an introductory course plus our research aspect in ITPCAS (Institute of Tibetan Plateau, Chinese Academy of Sciences) in the Climate Change for graduate students majored in Earth Sciences. This class is a synthesis of current knowledge of the climate system and past and present climates. It provides solid background information and includes critical assessments of issues that remain incompletely understood. There, it is up to the students to logically evaluate climate change issues presented daily by the media. This class will introduce related reference for climate researchers and students, especially for issues of climate change in Earth system. The class presents the basics surrounding climate change in a simple way while pointing out the complexity of climate data collection, processing, and interpretation. Our research aspect in ITPCAS will introduce climate change related topics, for example, land surface heat flux retrieve from in-situ data, satellite remote sensing data and numerical model; land surface model development and data assimilation; black carbon in the mountain glacier area; hydrological model and so on. All of these topics will enhance our theoretical questions about climate change, especially in the Tibetan Plateau.
The course is structured as a series of lectures and mini-seminars in which individual research cases are discussed with faculty tutors.

医学免疫学

课程编码：181M1014H 英文名称：Medical Immunology 课时：50 学分：3.50 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：赵勇等

教学目的要求
医学免疫学是医学生命科学的重要基础学科, 也是目前科学研究的前沿与热点。在提高人类健康及生物医药等产业发展中做出十分重要贡献。机体免疫系统与人类许多重大、常见疾病的发生发展及其防治密切相关。“医学免疫学”的研究生课程的设置将主要遵循：在对免疫学发展简史及基本概念与理论的进行介绍的基础上，讲解关键问题的提出与研究过程，重点介绍相关领域的发展现状、重要突破、新观点及发展趋势等内容。重点介绍免疫与人类各种疾病的关系，免疫学技术在临床疾病诊治的医学应用。此课程有别于本科对免疫学基础理论学习，强化学生对免疫系统地生理病理学意义地理解，注重免疫学研究基本科研素质的培养，希望对学生提出问题、解决问题的能力有所提高。

预修课程
免疫学、细胞生物学、分子生物学

教材

课程教师信息

课程名称: 病原微生物致病与耐药分子机制
英文名称: Molecular Mechanism of Microbial Pathogenesis and Drug Resistance
详细内容:
病原微生物致病与耐药分子机制

课程编码：181M2012H 英文名称：Molecular Mechanism of Microbial Pathogenesis and Drug Resistance 课时：30 学分：2.50 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：马旅雁等

教学目的要求
“病原微生物致病与耐药分子机制”是国科大医学院的研究生普及课程之一，是在医学微生物、细胞生物、分子生物等学科基础上重点介绍病原微生物的致病机理与耐药机制。此课程注重理解病原微生物导致疾病发生的毒力因子、病原微生物如何逃逸免疫机制、细菌抗药性产生的机制、微生物群体行为与通讯、以及正常菌群在机体生理和病理机制中的作用等。
通过本课程教学，使学生能够更深入地从多角度、多层次全面理解微生物的致病机理与耐药机制，了解该领域的前沿进展及发展方向和研究手段，提高科学逻辑思维的能力，活跃科研思路，为进入实验室课题研究打下良好的基础。

预修课程
分子生物学，细胞生物学，医学微生物学及进展或普通微生物学

1. Mishra S. K. and Agrawal D. A Concise Manual of Pathogenic Microbiology 2013.

医学病毒学

课程编码：181M1017H 英文名称：Outline of Medical Virology Course 课时：50 学分：3.50 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘文军等

教学目的要求
病毒是地球上最微小的非细胞生物，人类对它的本质及其生命规律的认识，经历了一个世纪，2003 “非典”、2004年和2005年的禽流感爆发，2009年甲型流感病毒（H1N1）的肆虐，以及最近在非洲爆发的埃博拉疫情使人们对病毒与人类的关系有了更深层次的认识。随着新的生物学技术在病毒学研究中的应用，病毒学研究获得了巨大的发展。其中分子病毒学是采用现代分子生物学的理论、新技术和新方法，来研究病毒的分子结构及其功能，以及病毒与病毒之间，病毒与宿主细胞之间关系的一门科学，现已成为病毒学领域中一门重要的分支学科。本课程将分为两部分：第一部分为病毒学概论，以讲授分子病毒学基本理论、基本概念为主，为学生奠定基本的病毒学知识。第二部分为分子病毒学的各论，通过对目前研究热点的病毒进行较为深入的讲解，激起学生对该领域前沿科学问题学习兴趣。同时我们也强调了抗病毒药物及预防性疫苗等生物制品研发的理论基础工作。
本课程为基础医学、微生物学专业研究生的专业基础课，同时也作为生物化学与分子生物学，免疫学，细胞生物学等相关专业研究生的选修课。

预修课程
生物化学、病毒学、分子生物学、细胞生物学

课程编码：181M1018H 英文名称：Practical Bioinformatics 课时：50 学分：3.50 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：韩春生

教学目的要求
通过该课程的学习，学生将能够掌握当代生物信息学研究的基本概念、原理和技能；将能够利用网络版和自己编写的软件进行基本的生物信息学分析。这是一门理论结合实际操作的重要课程，能够使一名有志于利用生物信息学方法从事生物医学研究的学生开启旅程，而不是停留在纸上谈兵和临渊羡鱼的境地。本课程注重实战，将会最大限度简化理论和算法的讲解。必须重点提醒学生，该课程要求学生具有初步的编程经验和数据库知识，但更大的挑战在于需要花较多时间进行课外自学和完成作业。

预修课程
分子生物学、统计学、C语言（若不符合要求，需要主讲教师特殊批准才可注册该课程）

教材
无教材，每节课都有指定阅读文献

主要内容
讲授内容:
第一章 生物信息学入门 （18学时）
1．生物信息学发展简史（3学时，布置第一次大作业）
2．Web Server及HTML（3学时）
3. PHP编程入门（3学时）
4．E-R型数据库入门（3学时）
5．R语言入门（3学时）
6. Bioconductor软件包简介（3学时）
教学重点与难点: 这个章节的重点是了解生物信息学的发展史，了解生物信息学必备的一些基础工具；难点在于要在较短时间内熟练掌握这些编程语言和数据库，为后续的学习打好基础。
第二章 序列分析 （20学时）
7.序列比对入门（3学时，布置第二次大作业）
8.利用FASTA与BLAST进行序列比对（3学时）
9．利用Bowtie和TOPHAT进行重测序映射（mapping）（3学时）
10. 利用Cufflinks组装转录本（3学时）
11. 利用Cuffdiff检测样本间差异表达的基因（3学时）
12. 模件搜寻（Motif search）（3学时）
13. 转录因子结合位点(TFBSs）分析（2学时）
教学重点与难点: 这个章节的重点是掌握序列比对的原理，方法。序列比对是生物信息学中基本的信息处理方法,对于发现生物序列中的功能、结构和进化信息具有重要的意义。难点在于理解序列比对方法是怎么应用的，如何利用序列比对解决不同的问题，并自己能加以运用。
第三章 从表达数据到基因调控网络 （12）
14. 生物芯片数据分析（3学时，布置第三次大作业）
15. 差异基因的分析（3学时）
16. 聚类分析(clustering)和主成分分析（Principal Component Analysis）分析（3学时）
17. 期末考试（3学时）
教学重点与难点: 这个章节的重点是了解从表达数据到基因调控网络的整个分析过程和方法；学生以后的科研活动中会经常用到的这些知识和技能；难点在于掌握这些分析方法的内在算法及实际意义，并能够灵活应用。

教学手段与方法：机房授课
考核方式： 课后作业（50%）+ 闭卷考试（50%）

参考文献
1) Bioinformatics: sequence and genome analysis, David W. Mount, New York : Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, 2004

课程教师信息

重大慢性传染病

课程编码：181M1019H 英文名称：Major Chronic Infectious Diseases 课时：50 学分：3.50 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：孟颂东等

教学目的要求
重大慢性传染病”是中国科学院大学科教融合型卓越创新中心的核心课程之一，由本领域中科院相关研究所杰出科学家授课。拟从学科发展史和基本原理出发，系统地讲述重要慢性传染病病原微生物的细胞免疫应答及机制，包括抗原呈递与细胞免疫应答，病原致病机理、宿主免疫机制，以及病原体与宿主互作机制等，并介绍该领域前沿和里程碑式成果的研究思路和生物学意义。阐述重要慢性病原微生物（如肝炎和HIV病毒、结核分枝杆菌等）的流行病学、基本生物学、生活史和感染机制，重点探讨慢性病原微生物抗原加工、呈递和T细胞识别与活化过程，宿主固有和适应性免疫特别是细胞免疫机制、宿主免疫识别、活化、记忆形成和调控机制，以及慢性感染病原体（如肝炎和HIV病毒、结核分枝杆菌等）的宿主免疫逃逸及相关的炎癌转化机制等方面的关键科学问题。探讨重要慢性病原微生物感染的预防和治疗策略。
本课程目标是让研究生了解“重大慢性传染病”研究背景和前沿，了解相关研究技术和策略，开拓学术视野、激发研究兴趣和启迪科研思路。

预修课程
微生物学

教材
微生物学，张利平主编，科学出版社，2012年

课程名称: 现代生殖医学之工程技术
详细内容:
现代生殖医学之工程技术

课程编码：181M2009H 英文名称：Modern Reproductive Medicine-Engineering 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：赵建国等

教学目的要求
课程对生殖相关的基本知识、前沿进展以及生殖工程技术在生殖医学中的应用进行了整体介绍，其中包括人类正常生殖过程、生殖工程学技术、生殖功能评估、微创技术在生殖医学中的应用、生殖工程学技术发展展望及相关伦理学问题等。通过本课程教学，使学生能全面了解人类生殖相关的基本知识，掌握人类生殖工程学的相关技术，熟悉生殖工程学的应用及相应的伦理问题和法律法规，了解人类生殖工程学的前沿进展及发展方向。

预修课程
发育生物学、生殖生物学

教材

生殖免疫学

课程编码：181M2008H 英文名称：Immunology of Reproduction 课时：30 学分：2.50 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：彭景楩等

教学目的要求
生殖免疫学的核心是研究生殖过程中各个环节存在的极其复杂的免疫学问题, 涉及生殖生理、妊娠生理、病理妊娠以及生殖控制等。本课程为生物学、基、础医学、临床医学、生物医学工程专业研究生的专业普及课，同时也可作生殖医学、干细胞生物学和再生医学相关专业研究生的选修课。通过本课程学习使学生了解母-胎免疫关系、配子的免疫学、着床的免疫学、子宫与胎盘的免疫学、免疫性不孕、自身免疫与妊娠、生殖道局部免疫、性传播疾病的免疫学、免疫避孕疫苗控制生育、自然流产的免疫防治等知识，进一步认识人类和哺乳动物的生殖过程是在机体生殖系统和免疫系统相互作用的稳定状态下顺利进行的。本课程的重点是母胎之间存在免疫豁免这一奇特的免疫学问题，难点是母胎界面免疫微环境的分子调节机理。
通过本课程的学习，使学生能比较系统和全面地掌握生殖免疫学的基础知识，了解生殖免疫学研究领域的新进展，为今后从事生殖与发育、基础医学、临床医学以及相关领域的研究提供扎实的知识基础，并为临床的诊断和治疗生殖免疫疾病提供新的视角。

预修课程
生理学、生殖内分泌学、医学免疫学

教材
生殖免疫学（自编）

主要内容
第一章：生殖免疫学基础（3学时，彭景楩）
1.1 免疫系统
本节重点介绍免疫器官、免疫细胞和免疫分子。
1.2免疫应答
本节重点介绍体液免疫应答、细胞免疫应答和B／T细胞的分化与功能。
1.3免疫耐受与自身免疫
本节重点介绍免疫耐受的一般特性与自身免疫病的特点。
1.4细胞因子与生殖
本节重点介绍免疫细胞分泌的细胞因子对生殖的影响。

第二章：精子免疫（3学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍作为男性自身组成物质的精子，为何具有强抗原性；正常生理情况下，男性或异性体内均未检测到抗精子抗体，其免疫生物学机制是什么。
2.1 男性生殖免疫生物学的组织学基础
2.2 精子发生的免疫生物学
2.3 精子的免疫性防御
2.4 精子抗原
2.5 抗精子抗体 (AsAb)
2.6 精子相关抗原的免疫避孕

第三章：卵子免疫（3学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍卵透明带（ZP）特异的抗原；ZP抗原性很强，主动和被动免疫均可诱发产生抗体，ZP为何具有异种交叉免疫应答特性；ZP疫苗抗生育的机制及副作用。
3.1 卵细胞的抗原
3.2 卵透明带（ZP）
3.3 卵透明带蛋白免疫
3.4 卵透明带蛋白/基因避孕疫苗
3.5 卵透明带（ZP）避孕疫苗研制新策略

第四章：母胎界面免疫（3学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍母胎界面免疫耐受形成机制及与子宫接受性的关联；uNK细胞、DC细胞、Treg细胞等在母胎界面免疫学功能特点和免疫生物学作用。
4.1 母胎界面组织结构的形成
4.2 植入与母胎界面免疫耐受
4.3 免疫细胞与免疫耐受
4.4 MHC分子与免疫耐受
4.5 细胞因子与免疫耐受

第五章：胚胎免疫（1.5学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍胎儿免疫应答；HLA-Ⅰ类抗原在滋养层的表达；封闭抗体产生的机制与其在母胎界面免疫耐受形成中的作用及临床意义。
5.1 胚胎
5.2 胚胎外膜免疫
（1）绒毛滋养层细胞MHC抗原表达
（2）滋养层免疫抑制因子
5.3 胚胎抗原
（1）胚胎抗原
（2）胚胎的同种抗原表达

第六章：胎盘免疫 （1.5学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍胎盘的免疫屏障及其免疫学特征；作为同种异体移植物的胎盘组织为何不被母体排斥。
6.1 胎盘与胎盘免疫屏障
6.2 胎盘免疫
（1）胎盘的保护作用
（2）胎盘免疫功能
6.3 胎盘滋养层细胞与免疫耐受

第七章：母胎免疫调节（3学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍母体免疫系统不排斥胚胎抗原归咎于复杂的母-胎界面特殊免疫调节机制，这一调节异常导致早产、流产等。
7.1 免疫调节
7.2 Th1/Th2平衡学说
7.3 Th17/Treg平衡学说
7.4 HLA-G免疫调节分子
7.5 DC免疫调节细胞

第八章：黏膜免疫系统（3学时，教师：赵同标）
本章重点介绍黏膜免疫系统及功能。
8.1 黏膜及相关淋巴组织
8.2 共同黏膜免疫系统
8.3 黏膜免疫调节机制

第九章：基础移植免疫学研究前沿与热点（3学时，教师：赵 勇）
9.1 记忆性T细胞在移植排斥中的作用
9.2 新型免疫细胞亚群在移植排斥中的作用
9.3 新型免疫抑制剂的研发
9.4 移植免疫耐受诱导方案的建立
9.5 表观遗传学在排斥中的作用
9.6 慢性排斥反应
9.7 异种移植的希望
9.8 移植排斥与耐受的有效临床检测

第十章：病理妊娠与免疫（3学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍正常妊娠是一种特殊类型的外周免疫耐受，这种耐受遭破坏则会导致流产、妊娠高血压综合症等病理妊娠。
10.1 自然流产与免疫
（1）反复性自然流产（RSA）与免疫；
（2）RSA的免疫流行病学评价
（3）RSA的免疫学病因
（4）RSA的免疫发病机制
（5）RSA的免疫学诊断
（6）RSA的免疫治疗
10.2 妊高症与免疫
（1）妊高症的免疫学病因
（2）免疫细胞与妊高症
（3）细胞凋亡与妊高症
（4）HLA-I 与妊高症
（5）妊高症的免疫遗传
（6）妊高症的免疫学防治

第十一章：卵巢功能早衰与免疫（1.5学时，教师：彭景楩）
本章重点介绍卵巢是免疫和神经内分泌系统共同作用的主要靶器官，二者相互作用保证卵巢功能的正常，任何一方异常均可导致卵巢功能异常乃至早衰。
11.1 卵巢功能早衰（POF）
11.2 POF发生率
11.3 POF免疫学病因
（1）自身免疫性POF
（2）卵巢抗体与POF
（3）抗透明带抗体与POF
（4）细胞免疫异常与POF
11.4卵巢功能早衰与其他自身免疫性疾病

第十二章：性传播疾病的免疫学（1.5学时，教师：彭景楩）

12.2 女性生殖道的免疫防御机制

课程名称: 结构生物学与医学研究
详细内容:
结构生物学与医学研究

课程编码：181M2011H 英文名称：Structural Biology and Medical Research 课时：30 学分：2.50 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：施一等

教学目的要求
课程对结构生物学、结构生物学在医学研究中的应用以及结构解析进行了整体介绍，其中包括结构生物学的研究历史与现状、结构生物学的的未来发展、结构生物学在免疫学中的应用、结构生物学在药物设计中的应用、冷冻电镜原理以及在医学研究中的应用、X-射线晶体学以及在医学研究中的应用。通过本课程教学，使学生能够全面了解结构生物学研究进展以及其在医学研究中的应用，了解冷冻电镜和X-射线晶体学的原理及其在医学研究中的应用。

预修课程
生物化学、分子生物学

教材

主要内容
绪论（3学时，教师：施一 研究员）
1.结构生物学简介 (课程形式：课堂授课)
1.1什么是结构生物学
1.2结构生物学的研究历史与现状
1.3结构生物学未来发展
第一部分 结构生物学在医学研究中的应用（6学时，教师：施一 研究员）
2.结构生物学在免疫学中的应用 (课程形式：课堂授课)
2.1免疫细胞受体和配体相互作用的结构生物学研究
2.2抗原和抗体相互作用的结构生物学研究
3.结构生物学在药物设计中的应用 (课程形式：课堂授课)
3.1药物与传染病病原的结构生物学研究
3.2药物与代谢性疾病靶标的结构生物学研究
第二部分 冷冻电镜原理以及在医学研究中的应用（9学时，教师：章新政 研究员）
4.冷冻电镜原理简介 (课程形式：课堂授课)
4.1高能电子性质
4.2高能电子与生物样品的相互作用
4.3电子显微镜构造
4.4高能电子在电镜中的传播（电子光学）
5.冷冻电镜在人类病毒研究中的应用 (课程形式：课堂授课)
5.1多种重要人类病毒的结构特征、结构解析
5.2登革热病毒的生命周期
5.3抗体中和机制（黄病毒、甲病毒等）
5.4病毒和受体的相互作用（登革热、HIV等）
6.冷冻电镜数据分析实例 (课程形式：上机实习；地点：中国科学院生物物理研究所)
6.1颗粒挑选
6.2衬度传递函数拟合
6.3结构优化
6.4三维重构密度图以及重构分辨率的确定
课程形式
第三部分 X-射线晶体学以及在医学研究中的应用（9学时，教师：齐建勋 研究员）
7.X-射线晶体学简介 (课程形式：课堂授课)
7.1晶体，对称型，空间群，布拉斐格子，晶系
7.2衍射基本理论，电子散射，原子散射，晶胞散射，晶体衍射，布拉格方程和Laue条件
7.3倒空间和Eward球构建
8.数据的收集、处理与结构解析 (课程形式：课堂授课)
8.1X-射线源，探测器，辐射损伤
8.2数据处理
8.3数据质量评估，数据完整性，分辨率，信噪比，R factor
8.4相位问题
8.5同晶置换法
8.6异常散射法（SAD/MAD）
8.7分子置换法（MR）
9.结构的精化和模型搭建 (课程形式：课堂授课)
9.1精化的数学描述，快速傅立叶变换原理
9.2具体精化方法
9.3原子模型搭建
9.4结构的评估
10.溶菌酶数据处理，分子置换法结构解析和结构精化实例 (课程形式：课堂授课)
第四部分 考试
11.考试（3学时）
教学方式：课堂授课+上机实习
考核方式：课堂笔记（10%）+ 课后作业（30%）+ 闭卷考试（60%）

参考文献
1．结构生物学-从原子到生命（科学出版社，Anders Liljas, Lara Liljas Jure Piskur, PoulNissen等编著，苏晓东等译， 2013年第一版）
2．免疫学（科学出版社，中国科学院著，2016年第一版）
3．结构生物学与现代药学研究（科学出版社，杨铭主编，2008年）

课程教师信息

课程名称: 医学病理学基础与临床
英文名称: Medical Pathology Basis and Related Clinic
详细内容:
医学病理学基础与临床

课程编码：181M1009H 英文名称：Medical Pathology Basis and Related Clinic 课时：50 学分：3.50 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：史桂芝等

教学目的要求
课程对与临床疾病相关的医学病理学基础知识、技术前沿进展、常见临床病理案例进行整体介绍，其中包括医学病理学基础知识、基本技术及前言进展、遗传病理及相关疾病。通过本课程教学，使学生能够全面了解人类疾病发生发展相关的临床病理特点、系统掌握各器官的病理知识，熟悉相关的新技术，了解病理学领域的前沿进展及发展方向。此外，根据国科大大部分研究生不具备临床医学的背景这一特殊性，对病理学了解甚少的特点，在具体的教学方面，增强课程的实用性及普及性，鉴于技术的通用性及科教融合的特点，在实际的具体教学中穿插研究所相关课题项目讲解科研思维及科研前沿。

预修课程
生理学、组织学与胚胎学、人体解剖学、遗传学、免疫学等

人体机能的细胞分子机制

课程编码：181M2018H 英文名称：The Cellular and Molecular Mechanism for Human Body Function 课时：40 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：汲娟娟等

教学目的要求
人体机能的细胞分子机制，是人体生理机能和相关疾病的细胞和分子事件流，是形成中的生命科学前沿学科细胞生理学的重要组成部分。本课程讲授与人体各种生理现象、疾病形成相关的细胞和分子过程及动因，以及相关的研究动态、技术发展。课程的学习将使学生掌握细胞生理学的基础知识、基本概念、基本原理；理解在细胞功能实现、重大疾病发生中细胞膜、细胞质、细胞器、关键分子的功能及功能实现过程中的物理化学规律；理解各种特化细胞的特征功能和病变的细胞、分子基础和最新研究热点；了解推动细胞生理学发展的主流技术方法；建立从细胞生理学、分子动力学的角度来理解、探究生命活动、病理、药理过程，以及新的治疗理念的思路。

预修课程

教材
《细胞生理学手册》（Cell Physiology Sourcebook, Nicholas Sperelakis, 4 Edition, 2012）

主要内容
第一章 绪论（汲娟娟，3 学时）
§1-1 人体机能的细胞基础 (概述)
§1-2 细胞功能的分子特化
§1-3细胞的生理环境
§1-4 生理溶液及其物理化学性质（重点）

第二章 细胞、分子机制异常与疾病（消化、内分泌系统疾病） （陈杰，6学时）

第三章 细胞膜与细胞信号转导（汲娟娟，3学时）
§3-1 细胞膜的成分、结构及研究过程
§3-2 信号转导与第二信使（概述）
§3-3 细胞内的游离钙离子（重点）
§3-4 细胞内高能磷酸化合物（重点）

第四章 跨膜转运与膜电位（汲娟娟，6学时）
§4-1 被动转运、主动转运和易化扩散
§4-2 Na+-K+ ATP酶（重点）
§4-3 Ca2+-ATP酶
§4-4 Na+-Ca2+交换
§4-5 静息膜电位的发生（重点）
§4-6 Gibbs-Donnan平衡电位（难点）
§4-7 动作电位的产生与传播（难点）

第五章 研究细胞及其蛋白质功能的主要技术方法（汲娟娟，讨论课, 3学时）
§5-1 细胞外电生理记录法（重点）
§5-2 细胞内电生理记录法
§5-3 膜片钳技术（重点）
§5-4 细胞内源性分子荧光（重点）
§5-5 分子荧光探针
§5-6 细胞葡萄糖摄取测定法
§5-7 氧化还原电极

第六章 离子通道的结构与功能（汲娟娟，3 学时）
§6-1 Na+离子通道（重点）
§6-2 K+离子通道（难点）
§6-3 Ca2+离子通道
§6-4 Cl-离子通道
§6-5 离子转运的原发性疾病

第七章 细胞内环境的维持（汲娟娟，3 学时）
§7-1 细胞内pH的调节（难点）
§7-2 细胞内Cl-的调节
§7-3 细胞容积调节（难点）

第八章 感觉信号的换能式转换（汲娟娟，3学时）
§8-1 体感细胞的信号转导（难点）
§8-2 听觉细胞的信号转导（重点）
§8-3 视觉细胞的信号转导（重点）
§8-4 味觉和细胞的信号转导
§8-5 肌肉细胞的兴奋-收缩偶联

第九章 细胞间通讯及细胞信号统合（汲娟娟，4学时）
§9-1 间隙连接
§9-2分泌（难点）
§9-3 受体（重点）
§9-4 神经元的信号整合功能及其能量调控
§9-5组织脏器间的细胞信号交流、统合与失衡

第十章 细胞、分子功能失调与肿瘤（白血病、肺癌） （周光飚，6学时）

期末考试 （汲娟娟, 2学时）

教学手段与方法：
讲授和课堂讨论分别约占90%和10%。
考核方式：
平时成绩：50分。
期末考试，开卷，50分。

参考文献
《细胞生理学》（Cell Physiology, David Landowne, 2006）
《神经科学——探索脑》（Neuroscience-Exploring The Brain，Marek F. Bear,4 Edition, 2014）
《细胞电生理学基本原理与膜片钳技术》（关兵才等, 科学出版社, 2013）

课程教师信息
授课人：汲娟娟 研究员（中国科学院生物物理研究所）
周光飚 研究员（中国科学院动物研究所）
陈杰 教授/主任医师（中国医学科学院、北京协和医院）
助教：张树利 （中国科学院生物物理研究所）

公共卫生概论

课程编码：181M2019H 英文名称：An Introduction to Public Health 课时：30 学分：2.50 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：罗会明等

教学目的要求
公共卫生概论是公共卫生入门的综合性的课程，其目的是通过综合的、归纳的、发展的和俯视的角度介绍公共卫生的专业背景、发展历史、现状、学科特点、当前的公共卫生理论与实践、公共卫生研究等内容，向学生敞开一扇公共卫生专业的大门，为学生指引一条公共卫生专业学习和发展的道路，让学生了解公共卫生事业的过程中，有目的地学习专业知识、掌握专业技能、构建专业思想和提高专业素质。
本课程不在于公共卫生各学科的入门，也不在于各学科的深入学习及技能的掌握，而在于让学生能够了解公共卫生的概貌及各相关学科的关系，同是也要让学生能够了解公共卫生各相关学科与其它交叉学科的关系；本课程不仅通过教师讲授知识，同时更需要教师启发学生思考；本课程不仅在于通过学习提高学生对公共卫生的认识和理解，更需要引导学生主动、有意识地在今后各专业的学习过程中能够融会贯通。

预修课程
预防医学、卫生学

教材

主要内容
前言：公共卫生概述和发展历史（3学时）
1. 公共卫生概述和发展历史（3学时，教师：罗会明）
1.1公共卫生的概念、目标及任务；
1.2 公共卫生及其事业的特点；
1.3 公共卫生与预防医学的含义、关系及区别。
1.4 公共卫生的发展历史
1.5 公共卫生的使命和成绩
第一部分：公共卫生理论和实践（21学时）
2. 公共卫生监测基础（3学时，教师：罗会明）
3. 现场流行病学概述与突发公共卫生事件应急（3学时，教师：罗会明）
4. 传染病监测和预防控制（3学时，教师：李中杰）
课程形式：现场参观考察
上课地点：中国疾病预防控制中心昌平园区
5. 疫苗与疾病预防控制（3学时，教师：罗会明）
课程形式：现场参观考察
上课地点：怀柔区疾病预防控制中心、社区卫生服务中心
6. 慢性病预防与控制（3学时，教师：吴静）
7. 环境与健康 （3学时，教师：施小明）
8．全球公共卫生的现状和未来（3学时，教师：李中杰）
第三部分：公共卫生研究（6学时）
9. 从公共卫生研究的证据到干预（3学时，教师：吴静）
10. 公共卫生研究实例（3学时，教师：施小明）

教学手段与方法：课堂授课、现场参观考察

考核方式：考勤（30%）+开卷考试（70%）

参考文献
李立明. 《预防医学和公共卫生导论》. 人民卫生出版社. 2017
Roger Detels. 《Oxford Textbook of Global Public Health》. Oxford University Press. 2015
Bernard J. Thunock. 《Public Health: What It Is and How It Works》.2012

课程教师信息
授课人：

李中杰 研究员 （中国疾病预防控制中心）
吴 静 研究员 （中国疾病预防控制中心）
施小明 研究员 （中国疾病预防控制中心）

课程名称: 精准基因组医学新技术前沿研讨课
英文名称: Seminars: Advanced Genomic Technologies in Precision Medicine Era
详细内容:
精准基因组医学新技术前沿研讨课

课程编码：181M3001H 英文名称：Seminars: Advanced Genomic Technologies in Precision Medicine Era 课时：30 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科研讨课 主讲教师：蔡军等

教学目的要求
通过授课的方式使医学科学及相关专业学生广泛地了解与基因组医学研究领域相关的实验和分析技术的研究现状，并通过论文阅读和讨论的方式进一步把握这些技术在精准医学健康应用领域的前沿应用动向，积极培养学生科学理性的思维方式、讨论科学论文的基本技巧以及从最新文献中深入掌握专业知识的科研能力。

预修课程

教材

主要内容
1 精准基因组医学与基因组新技术概述 （2学时，教师：蔡军）
1.1 精准基因组医学
1.2 基因组新技术

2 基因组学测序与分析新技术（2学时，教师：蔡军）
2.1 基因组学测序新技术
2.2组学数据的生物信息分析新技术

3基因组测序与分析技术与精准基因组医学 （2学时，教师：蔡军）
学生讲述，并讨论1-2篇精准基因组医学研究中应用基因组测序与分析新技术的文献

4 单细胞组学新技术（2学时，教师：蔡军）
单细胞组学新技术

5 单细胞组学新技术研讨（2学时，教师：蔡军）
学生讲述，并讨论1-2篇单细胞组学技术的新技术、新应用的文献

6 基因组学新技术与生殖健康（2学时，教师：蔡军）
单细胞基因组等技术与生殖健康

7基因组学在生殖健康领域的应用研讨 （2学时，教师：蔡军）
学生讲述，并讨论基因组学与生殖健康相关的1-2篇最新研究文献

8单细胞分辨率下的癌症组学研究（2学时，教师：蔡军）
单细胞癌症组学研究新技术

9单细胞分辨率下的癌症组学研究研讨 （2学时，教师：蔡军）
学生讲述，并讨论1-2篇单细胞癌症组学的最新研究文献

10癌症的诊断和个性化治疗新技术（2学时，教师：米双利）
液体早期诊断新技术

11癌症的液体诊断研讨 （2学时，教师：米双利）
学生讲述，并比较讨论关于癌症的不同液体诊断方法的研究文献

12基因组编辑技术的最新发展 （2学时，教师：米双利）
基因组编辑新技术

13基因组编辑新技术与精准基因组医学的研讨 （2学时，教师：米双利）
学生讲述，并讨论1-2篇关于基因组编辑技术的最新研究文献

14 未来精准基因组医学新技术的研讨 （2学时，教师：蔡军）
学生可自由选题，讲述基因组学在未来医学健康领域的应用及研究现状，

15 课程考核：提交论文综述（2学时）
提交精准基因组医学新技术前沿研讨课程论文综述

教学手段与方法：课堂授课（30%）+ 课堂研讨（50%）+ 课后阅读、论文综述(20%)

考核方式：课堂表现（20%）+ 论文研讨（40%）+论文综述（40%）

参考文献

课程教师信息
蔡 军 研究员 （中国科学院北京基因组研究所）
米双利 研究员 （中国科学院北京基因组研究所）

课程名称: 天然产物药物的生物合成及生物催化
英文名称: Biosynthesis and Biocatalysis of Natural Product Drug
详细内容:
天然产物药物的生物合成及生物催化

课程编码：182M2001H 英文名称：Biosynthesis and Biocatalysis of Natural Product Drug 课时：40 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：尹文兵等

教学目的要求
天然产物药物以其多样的骨架结构和广泛的生物活性特性一直是药物研发的重要来源。随着生命科学新理论的不断出现以及新技术、新方法的日新月异，特别是近年来，基因组学、蛋白质组学、生物信息学、质谱联用等技术的发展日益成熟，天然产物药物的生物合成机制及生物催化基本理论的阐明对天然药物来源的创新药物研发产生深远影响，同时也成为后基因组时代天然产物药物研究的热点。
通过《天然产物药物的生物合成及生物催化》课程的学习，使学生了解天然产物药物生物合成的研究历史、核心问题和研究意义；了解和掌握生物体产生天然产物药物的分子生物学基础；了解和掌握利用常用的天然产物药物生物合成基因簇的生物信息学分析数据库和分析的基本原理和方法；了解常见的非核糖体多肽类、聚酮类等多种类型化合物的相应基因簇和骨架酶的特征及其基本的生物合成机制；了解基于基因组挖掘技术发展而来的天然产物药物发现新策略和新技术；了解利用合成生物学理念和技术在天然产物药物研发中的研究方法和研究进展；了解天然产物药物的生物催化的基础知识、基本原理和一般研究方法和技能。
本课程的开展将着力培养学生新时期从事天然产物药物研发的能力，为继承我国医药学宝库和推动我国药学事业的发展奠定基础。

预修课程
分子生物学、天然产物化学

教材
药用天然产物的生物合成（2008年，娄红祥 主译）

主要内容
1、天然产物药物生物合成的研究历史、研究主题、核心问题和研究意义 （3学时，教师：尹文兵）
1.1天然产物药物生物合成的研究历史、现状与未来发展
1.2天然产物药物生物合成与分子生物学
1.3天然产物药物生物合成与组学
2、天然产物药物生物合成的遗传学基础（3学时，教师：尹文兵）
2.1天然产物药物生物合成相关的基因
2.2生物信息学分析天然产物生物合成的合成基因
2.3实例分析与讲解
3、天然产物药物生物合成机制（3学时，教师：尹文兵）
3.1 PKS作用机制及范例
3.2 NRPS作用机制及范例
3.3 其他类型天然产物的生物合成
4、天然产物药物的基因组挖掘（3学时，教师：尹文兵）
4.1 基于异戊烯基类转移酶的天然产物药物挖掘
4.2基于表观遗传调控因子到天然产物药物挖掘
4.3 异源表达挖掘天然产物药物
5、糖苷类天然产物药物的生物合成（3学时，教师：陈义华）
5.1 糖苷类天然产物药物的介绍
5.2 天然产物药物中各种特殊糖基的生物合成机制
5.3 糖苷类天然产物药物的生物合成
6、萜类天然产物药物的生物合成（3学时，教师：陈义华）
6.1 异戊二烯来源的天然产物简介
6.2萜类天然产物药物的介绍
6.3 萜类天然产物药物的生物合成
7、天然产物药物的组合生物合成与合成生物学研究（3学时，教师：陈义华）
7.1 天然产物药物的组合生物合成研究
7.2天然产物药物的合成生物学研究
7.3 天然产物药物的设计和创制前景
8. 制备天然产物生物催化剂的设计（3学时，教师：吴边）
8.1 天然产物生产过程中的生物催化总论
8.2 酶的定向进化与计算机设计
8.3 代谢工程与全细胞催化
9. 抗生素类天然产物生产（3学时，教师：吴边）
9.1 β-内酰胺类抗生素
9.2 多肽类抗生素
9.3 氨糖类抗生素
10. 其他类别重要天然产物的生产（3学时，教师：吴边）
10.1 糖苷类
10.2 甾体类
10.3 他丁类
11. 实验实习课（2学时，教师：尹文兵，陈义华，吴边）
11.1 真菌天然产物的异源表达
11.2 放线菌天然产物的生物合成
11.3 计算机蛋白质设计
12. 上机课（3学时，教师：吴边）
12.1 生物大分子与小分子的识别模型介绍
12.2 蛋白准备与活性位点发现
12.3 构象探索及分子对接结果分析评价
13. 天然产物药物生物合成的前沿进展（3学时，教师：尹文兵）
考试（2学时）
教学方式：80 % 课堂授课 + 20 % 研讨/实习/论文
考核方式：考勤（10%）+课堂笔记（20%）+ 小论文考试（70%）

参考文献
1、“天然产物研究方法和技术”再帕尔.阿里不孜主编，-北京：化学工业出版社，2009
2、“微生物基因组学及合成生物学进展” 邓子新、喻子牛主编，-北京：科学出版社，2014，ISBN：7030404580。

天然产物新药开发

课程编码：182M2003H 英文名称：Drug Development of Natural Compounds 课时：40 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科普及课 主讲教师：马晓丰等

教学目的要求
新药研究是生命科学和医学研究的一个重要内容，是人类卫生保健事业的重要组成部分，是社会经济发展的支柱之一。本课程定位于中国科学院大学药学、生物学、化学等专业的研究生，按照研究生教学特点，强调实际应用与前沿进展，着重介绍新药研究过程中所涉及的一些重大问题。要求研究生从新药研究开发的角度掌握现代医药学研究进展，使学生了解新药开发的科研思路及其主要研究方法；同时对新药评价的主要内容和新药申报审批的主要程序有所了解。引导研究生开展边缘交叉学科的综合研究并为研究生开展新药研究及相关学科的实验研究铺路奠基。希望研究生通过本课程的学习，知识面有所扩展，为今后的研究工作奠定基础。

预修课程
预备知识：药物化学，药理学，药剂学，生物化学，分析化学，有机化学，无机化学
预修课程：天然药物化学、生物化学、药理学、药剂学、药事法规等

教材
“天然产物新药开发”课件

主要内容
绪论----新药的发现 （4学时，教师：马晓丰）
1、 新药的定义

1.2 新药研究的特点
1.3 发现新药的主要途径
第一部分：新药开发相关的法规和选题思路（12学时，教师：马晓丰）
2、 我国新药开发的基本现状
2.1我国新药开发取得的成就
2.2高校、制药企业、新药开发公司的现状
2.3我国新药开发面临的问题
2.4新药研究的趋势
3、 新药研究相关法规及组织机构
3.1新药研究相关法规
3.1.1 药品管理法
3.1.2 药品管理法实施条例
3.1.3 药品注册管理办法
3.1.4 其它有关的法规
3.2 新药研究相关的组织机构
3.2.1 国家食品药品监督管理总局
3.2.2 药品审评中心
3.2.3 国家药典委员会
3.2.4 其它相关的组织机构
4、 天然药物新药分类及申报资料要求

4.2 不同类别新药的比较
4.3不同类别新药的申报资料要求
5、 新药研究的思路和选题
5.1 新药研究选题的原则
5.2 新药研究的科学性、创新性
5.3新药研究的可行性、效益性
5.4新药研究选题的实例
第二部分：新药的生产工艺及质量标准研究（14学时，教师：马晓丰）
6、 天然药物的药材来源
6.1 历代本草学著作
6.2 中药的药性及与药效的关系
6.3中药的炮制
6.4道地药材及道地性
7、 中药新药的处方与方解

7.2 中药组方的原则

8、 新药的生产工艺研究
8.1 新药生产工艺的特点
8.2 新药生产工艺研究的原则
8.3新药生产工艺的一般步骤
8.4新药的剂型
9、 新药的质量标准研究
9.1 药品质量标准的定义及要求

9.3质量标准的特点
9.4新药的稳定性评价
9.5 天然药物的指纹图谱
第三部分：新药的药效学及毒理学研究（6学时，教师：宝丽）
10、 新药的有效性研究

11、 新药的安全性研究

第四部分：新药的临床试验（2学时，教师：宝丽）
12、 新药的临床试验

考试（2学时）
教学方式：课堂授课
考核方式：平时作业和测验30% + 期终开卷考试70%

VLSI电路与系统设计

课程编码：191M4001H 英文名称：VLSI Circuit and System Design 课时：50 学分：3.00 课程属性：专业核心课 主讲教师：王源

教学目的要求
主要讲解CMOS VLSI 电路发展中在器件结构和电路结构方面的改进及其对电路性能的影响。首先分析CMOS VLSI 发展的指导理论—Scaling-Down 的具体规则，以及器件尺寸不断缩小的作用和影响。 在对器件深入分析的基础上重点讲解VLSI 电路的几个主要方面（ VLSI 存储器、运算器和控制器）的电路结构及电路设计考虑。在电路分析的基础上讨论VLSI 电路的设计方法，全定制和半定制设计方法。最后简单讨论后摩尔时代CMOS 电路的发展。

预修课程
半导体器件物理，数字逻辑电路，数字集成电路

教材
王源，贾嵩，崔小欣，王润声，甘学温．超大规模集成电路分析与设计．北京大学出版社．2014

主要内容
第1章第1节：绪论
第1章第2节：按比例缩小和高场效应
第1章第3节：器件参数涨落波动性
第1章第4节：集成电路寄生效应
第2章第1节：存储器概论和DRAM存储器
第2章第2节：SRAM存储器
第2章第3节：Flash存储器
第2章第4节：新型存储器
第3章第1节：加法器设计
第3章第2节：ALU和乘法器设计
第4章：控制器设计
第5章：集成电路设计方法学
第6章后摩尔时代集成电路设计

参考文献
主要参考书：
1. Jan M Rabaey．数字集成电路设计透视（第2版）．清华大学出版社．2004
2. 尼尔 H.E. 威斯特．CMOS大规模集成电路设计．机械工业出版社．2005
3. 甘学温，贾嵩，王源，孙雷．大规模集成电路原理与设计．机械工业出版社．2010
